definition.title: What is Macular Degeneration?
definition.content: Macular degeneration is an age-related eye disorder that affects the central part of the retina, called the macula. This condition can lead to a progressive loss of central vision, eventually causing blindness if left untreated. Latest treatments, such as injections and laser therapy, are effective in managing the disease.

symptoms.title: Symptoms
listItems: Dark areas in the central vision

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: There is no cure for macular degeneration, but several treatments are available to slow its progression and manage the symptoms.
